title: Survivor of Seoul Halloween Crowd Surge Describes Chaotic Scene
description: One teenager and her friend were engulfed by the crowd but managed to crawl out, were pulled into a tavern by adults, then escaped by inching along alley walls.

title: Russia Withdraws From Grain Deal After Drone Attack on Black Sea Fleet
description: The Russian move jeopardized a rare case of wartime coordination aimed at lowering global food prices and combating hunger.

title: Will One Tuscan Port Stall Italy’s Drive for Energy Independence?
description: The residents of tiny Piombino understand the need to replace Russian gas imports. They just want a huge regasification vessel anchored somewhere else.

title: Will One Tuscan Port Stall Italy’s Drive for Energy Independence?
description: The residents of tiny Piombino understand the need to replace Russian gas imports. They just want a huge regasification vessel anchored somewhere else.

title: How the Grain Deal Between Ukraine and Russia Worked
description: The process required the collaboration of the two warring nations, along with Turkey and the United Nations.

title: Halloween Crowd Surge Turns Deadly in South Korean Capital
description: The incident occurred on one of the most raucous nights of the year in Seoul. Dozens were reported to have gone into cardiac arrest in the crush of revelers in the Itaewon district.

title: Two Explosions Rock Busy Intersection in Mogadishu
description: The attack comes as the newly elected government battles terrorist activity with a series of new measures aimed at the terrorist group Al Shabab.

title: With Western Weapons, Ukraine Is Turning the Tables in an Artillery War
description: In the southern Kherson region, Ukraine now has the advantage in range and precision guidance of artillery, rockets and drones, erasing what had been a critical Russian asset.

title: In Russia, Memorial Forced to Downsize Tribute to Stalin Victims
description: Memorial typically conducts a marathon reading of the names, ages, professions and dates of death of those killed under Stalin, but it had to find other ways to honor the victims after the authorities banned it.

title: Another Israeli Election Looms, and a Familiar Face Plans a Comeback
description: Ousted from the prime minister’s office 16 months ago, Benjamin Netanyahu, the leading candidate, is out to prove his political obituaries were premature.

title: Saudi Halloween: Once-Banned Holiday Now Haunted by Masked Monsters
description: Only a few years ago, a Halloween party meant arrest. Now, a government-sponsored “horror weekend” means sold-out costume shops and scary clowns. “Saudi is changing,” said a young man going as a wizard.

title: Bolsonaro vs. Lula: What to Know About Brazil’s Runoff Election
description: The vote comes after a long and ugly campaign that pits two major political figures against each other in race that has tested the country’s democracy.

title: Garden Varieties
description: Fall is well and truly here. It’s a good time to check in with your houseplants.

title: One in Five Canadians Is Now an Immigrant, and the Nation Approves
description: Even as immigration has become increasingly divisive in many Western countries, particularly the United States, polls indicate that most Canadians support it.

title: U.S. Releases Guantánamo’s Oldest Prisoner
description: Saifullah Paracha, 75, was accused of being a Qaeda sympathizer and was held for two decades. But he was never charged with a crime.

title: Brazil Confronts a Momentous Bolsonaro vs. Lula Election
description: Brazilians head to the polls on Sunday in an election between two political heavyweights that could have global repercussions.

title: At Least 45 Dead as Nalgae Makes Landfall in the Philippines
description: Severe Tropical Storm Nalgae made landfall early Saturday and was expected to continue bringing strong winds and torrential rain to large areas of the country through the weekend.

title: Electrical Workers Contend With Attacks to Pull Ukraine Out of the Dark
description: In the weeks since dozens of aerial attacks severely damaged 30 percent of the national power grid, workers have been racing to make repairs.

title: Australians Come Home After Years  in ISIS Detention Camp
description: Dozens more Australians, many of them children, are still being held in Syria, but there is hope that the government will soon sponsor more releases.
